text_block_list.name: Winning Ticket
text_block_list.text:
You're going for the Arima Kinen?! That means you'll race against 
your sister!

text_block_list.name: Narita Brian
text_block_list.text: An opponent who can win against me…

Camp finishes without a hitch, and though it's now autumn, the 
Twinkle Series is wrapped in what feels like the heat of midsummer.

In the center of that heat are the sisters Narita Brian and Biwa 
Hayahide.

text_block_list.name: Caster
text_block_list.text:
Narita Brian conquers the Kikuka Sho, beating last year's record by 
Biwa Hayahide!

text_block_list.name: Caster
text_block_list.text: Before you is the fifth ever Triple Crown champion!
The younger sister crushes the Japanese Derby, so the elder breaks the record for the Takarazuka Kinen. Then the younger sister breaks another record.

They may be competing in different races, but the whole racing 
world's watching their records as if they're facing each other.

Everyone believed it wouldn't be long before we saw the two race 
head-to-head in the Arima Kinen. That is, until recently…

text_block_list.name: Gold Ship
text_block_list.text: Reporters are still crawling all over this place. What a show.

text_block_list.name: Mejiro McQueen
text_block_list.text: Of course. It's a stunning feat to become a Triple Crown champion.

text_block_list.name: Mejiro McQueen
text_block_list.text:
Who knows when we'll see such a historic event again? This kind of 
media attention is a given.

text_block_list.name: Gold Ship
text_block_list.text:
Welp, they must be pretty disappointed that the all-important Brian's 
nowhere to be found.

text_block_list.name: Mejiro McQueen
text_block_list.text: Isn't she visiting her sister in the hospital?
Yeah, I told her she should.
Yeah, I told her she should.

text_block_list.name: Mejiro McQueen
text_block_list.text:
She refused when I asked her to go with me. Perhaps she wasn't 
prepared at the time.

text_block_list.name: Gold Ship
text_block_list.text: Well, she's family after all. That'd be a shock for anyone.

text_block_list.name: Mejiro McQueen
text_block_list.text:
That and I believe Brian was rather excited to be racing Hayahide in 
the Arima Kinen.

That's true. Every time Hayahide achieved something big, the flame 
in Brian's eyes would grow even stronger.

Her desire to compete against her sister was so strong that she 
considered even the Triple Crown a mere stepping stone on the way 
to her goal. But now…

text_block_list.name: Mejiro McQueen
text_block_list.text:
It's quite a letdown to not be able to race against the person you've 
always wanted to challenge.
Brian…

text_block_list.name: Biwa Hayahide
text_block_list.text: I wish I could've stopped the mighty Triple Crown winner.

text_block_list.name: Narita Brian
text_block_list.text: Glad to see you're well enough to talk big.

text_block_list.name: Biwa Hayahide
text_block_list.text:
My injury in the Tenno Sho (Autumn) was worse than I realized. Such a 
shame, really… I'd already formulated my winning equation to defeat 
you.

text_block_list.name: Narita Brian
text_block_list.text:
Only you would think to use equations in a race. This is why I always 
called you Big Head Biwa.

text_block_list.name: Biwa Hayahide
text_block_list.text: M-my head isn't that big!

text_block_list.name: Biwa Hayahide
text_block_list.text:
Brian, my equations aren't empty theories. I was set to win the Arima 
Kinen.

text_block_list.name: Biwa Hayahide
text_block_list.text:
Do you remember the sports competition you won when we were 
young?

text_block_list.name: Narita Brian
text_block_list.text: No, not really.

text_block_list.name: Biwa Hayahide
text_block_list.text:
I figured… Ever since then, winning's been natural for you. It means so 
little to you that you don't remember placing first in the competition.

text_block_list.name: Biwa Hayahide
text_block_list.text:
A genius mathematician is never satisfied with mundane problems. 
The only joy they find is in tackling the unsolvable.

text_block_list.name: Biwa Hayahide
text_block_list.text:
It's the same for you. You're not satisfied with ordinary races because 
of your outstanding talent. You have an appetite that can't be sated.

text_block_list.name: Biwa Hayahide
text_block_list.text:
I can't compete with you using mere effort. So I sought for a solution, 
and what I found is the method I use now.

text_block_list.name: Biwa Hayahide
text_block_list.text:
The results I've produced prove that I'm not shooting in the dark. I've 
nailed down my formula.

text_block_list.name: Narita Brian
text_block_list.text: I would've preferred you prove it to me in the Arima Kinen.

text_block_list.name: Biwa Hayahide
text_block_list.text:
I'll get to the point. I've had plenty of time lying here, so I've made an 
equation for the Arima Kinen, removing myself from the variables.

text_block_list.name: Biwa Hayahide
text_block_list.text: But no matter how much I recalculate, the results show that you'll win.

text_block_list.name: Biwa Hayahide
text_block_list.text:
I'm not sure how you feel not getting to race against me there, but… 
you've got to win this one, Brian.

text_block_list.name: Narita Brian
text_block_list.text: …Heh.

text_block_list.name: Narita Brian
text_block_list.text:
You didn't need some special equation to tell me that. Obviously I'm 
going to win.

text_block_list.name: Narita Brian
text_block_list.text:
And even if you were there, you'd see your work really is just empty 
theories once I beat you.

text_block_list.name: Narita Brian
text_block_list.text: So promise that you'll prove those equations of yours to me one day.
